page.title: 10NEWBOLD SCHOOL
page.content: Newbold School has forty children.Twenty come from Newbold itself,the rest coming from the surrounding villages,which are Armscote,Wimpstone,Blackwell, Tredington and Idlicote.The school was founded in 1847,making it 138 years old.The children start at Newbold School at the age of four and a half years and leave when eleven.They will go on to the secondary schools either at Shipston,Kineton or Stratford,or to King Edward the Seventh Grammar school for Boys or Shottery Grammar School for Girls in Stratford. There are no aids for children to cross the busy main road.The entrance is in Moss Lane.There is no school bus,the children arrive on foot,on bicycles and in cars. The school is soon going to merge with Tredington School.
